sentence.Network_en: They looked rather comical as they crawled up precarious ladders.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们顺着摇摇晃晃的梯子往上爬，看起来非常滑稽。

sentence.Network_en: He earned a precarious living as an artist.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一个艺术家，他过的是朝不保夕的生活。

sentence.Network_en: They eke out a precarious existence foraging in rubbish dumps.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们靠在垃圾场捡垃圾维持着朝不保夕的生活.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语反义词 - 豆丁网 ... pout 绷脸>露齿笑 precarious 不稳定的>安全的 precipitate 促进>妨碍/拖拉.
普通英汉小词典_翻译家(Fanyijia.com) ... preacher 传道者 precarious 危险的 precaution 预防.
SAT常考单词_百度文库 ... indifference 不关心，不在乎 precarious 不确定的；不稳固的 skeptical 怀疑性的.
雅思英语完整版_馆档网 ... preach 传教；讲道；劝诫；鼓吹 precarious 不稳定的，不安全的 precaution 预防.

list.abs: 晃晃(perched precariously), 此释义来源于网络辞典。
... 爱之如命 inordinately fond of sth 不绝如缕 almost extinct;hanging by a thread;very precarious 定题情报提供 sdi.
he was unable to get down from his precarious position on the rocks ., 他无法从岩石危险的位置上下来.

the Bucks found themselves in a precarious situation after their first six games , Sporting a 2-4 record after two humbling road losses to the Houston Rockets and the San Antonio Spurs .六场比赛之后，现在雄鹿的处于一种不稳定状态，留下2胜4负的记录，其中包括2场输给火箭和马刺，这是2场耻辱的失利。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin precarius 'obtained by entreaty' (from prex, prec- 'prayer') + -ous

entry.tran: （局势）不确定的，不稳定的，危险的
entry.def: If your situation is precarious, you are not in complete control of events and might fail in what you are doing at any moment.

example.ex: Our financial situation had become precarious.
example.tran: 我们的财务状况已变得不稳定了。

entry.def: Something that is precarious is not securely held in place and seems likely to fall or collapse at any moment.

example.ex: They looked rather comical as they crawled up precarious ladders.
example.tran: 他们顺着摇摇晃晃的梯子往上爬，看起来非常滑稽。

sentences.sentence: "a perilous voyage across the Atlantic in a small boat"
"the precarious life of an undersea diver"
"dangerous surgery followed by a touch-and-go recovery"

auth_sentence.content: I imagine it as being precarious, yet peaceful.
auth_sentence.res_content: I imagine it as being precarious, yet peaceful.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I imagine it as being precarious, yet peaceful.

auth_sentence.content: But, like others, their relationship is precarious.
auth_sentence.res_content: But, like others, their relationship is precarious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But, like others, their relationship is precarious.

auth_sentence.content: We consider this to be a very precarious situation.
auth_sentence.res_content: We consider this to be a very precarious situation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We consider this to be a very precarious situation.

stems_affixes.word_buile: pre在……前的,预先+built建造的,build的过去式和过去分词→adj.预制的
pre在……前的,预先+car=care关心+ious……的→要预先关心的→冒险的
pre在……前的,预先+cise切→预先切好的→精确的
pre在……前的,预先+coc=coct煮+ious……的→提前煮熟→早熟的
pre在……前的,预先+school学校→上学前的
pre在……前的,预先+sci知道+ent表形容词→预先知道
pre在……前的,预先+amble跑→跑在前面→前言
pre在……前的,预先+caution小心→预先小心→预防
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+ent人或物等→走在前面的东西→先例
pre在……前的,预先+cept拿→以前拿好的[名言]→格言
pre在……前的,预先+cinct捆→预先捆好的→范围
pre在……前的,预先+cipice头→在前面是尽头→峭壁
pre在……前的,预先+cipit头→ation→落在前头→降落,下降
pre在……前的,预先+destination目的地→预先定好的目的地→命中注定
pre在……前的,预先+disposition性情→性情预定→癖性
pre在……前的,预先+fix固定→固定在前面→前缀
pre在……前的,预先+history历史→n.史前
pre在……前的,预先+occup占有+ation表名词→优先占有[注意力]→全神贯注
pre在……前的,预先+position位置→位置放在前面→前置词
pre在……前的,预先+rog要求+ative表名词→预先要求→[有]特权
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+e→走在前面→[时间上]先于
pre在……前的,预先+clud关闭+e→提前关闭→阻止
pre在……前的,预先+dict说→预先说→预言
pre在……前的,预先+fer带来→先带来→更喜欢
pre在……前的,预先+pay付钱→v.预付

means.word_mean: (情势)不稳的; 不确定的; 不保险的; 危险的

sentences.en: He earned a precarious living as an artist.
sentences.cn: 作为一个艺术家，他过得是朝不保夕的生活。

sentences.en: The museum is in a financially precarious position.
sentences.cn: 这家博物馆的财政状况不稳定。

means.word_mean: 摇摇欲坠的; 不稳固的

sentences.cn: 那梯子看来摇摇晃晃的。

sentences.en: The Path down to the beach is very precarious in wet weather.
sentences.cn: 通往海滨的小路雨天非常湿滑危险。

jushi.english: A soldier leads a very precarious life.
jushi.chinese: 军人过着非常危险的生活。
